Excellent earnings report this morning and decent conference call, 2022 looking very positive - as long as this pandemic gets under control, KO should really excel forward, tough day in the market as usual and KO still held up nicely. Will be looking for some upgraded price targets in the coming weeks, I believe Nov/Dec price action will be considerably higher from here, congratulations to KO & shareholders here. Another Dividend will be paid mid December and I believe it's the 3rd week of February every year, when KO announces their Dividend increase for the year, looking forward to this also..

Coca Cola under the leadership of James Quincey has beat wall street's expectations in the last 7 earnings reports . That is why Coca Cola is a great buy and hold dividend aristocrat for any retierment account , they have always had great leadership .

Good news/bad news:The Braves lost last night (bad)The good news is there will be THREE All Star games played at Truist Park. There's even a "Coke Corner" that incorporates multiple left field sections. Any ticket in the Coca-Cola Corner comes with a free 20 ounce Coke product!!!.I imagine television views will see "Coke" a few times during the next three games being broadcast. A bit of a bonus for the bucks KO pays to be a "part" of the Braves.

Karel, expect $56 by year end and an increase in dividend for 2022. Share price somewhere around $60 to $62 by end of 2022. That's kind of how this stock goes. Don't expect more than 10% total increase per year including the dividends over time. Just be prepared to hang on during the down times like the past two years. So in the long run, like I said, Don't expect more than 7% annual growth plus the 3% dividend.

One year old fun fact ( After being acquired by Coca Cola for £3.9bn ($4.8bn) in late 2018, it was only a matter of time before Costa Coffee entered the US market, where the global brand has been curiously absent. Speaking on an investor call on October 22 2020, Coca-Cola Chairman and CEO James Quincey reiterated his firm’s intention to become a “global multi-platform coffee company under the Costa brand.”) November 10, 2020 Costa Coffee Acquires Austin-Based Coffee Kiosk Maker Briggo . Costa has yet to open any brick-and-mortar coffee shops in the United States, it does operate about 50 “Smart Cafes” around the country. Those are essentially freestanding super-automatic bean-to-cup beverage vending machines, capable of a variety of milk-based coffee drinks. All are operated and managed by the Costa Coffee team in Austin, Texas . Another reason Coca Cola is a great buy , and if Costa Coffee starts opening brick-and-mortar coffee shops in the United States it will give Starbucks a run for their money .

Nice bump today! Long KO!

In the 6 years I have owned this stock I have averaged an 8% return if you include the dividends I have received. That's good enough for me at my age and I can sleep at night. I'm fortunate I didn't have to sell any shares during the worst of the pandemic pull back. I'm not planning to sell any shares for another 8 years. I have started taking the dividends as cash recently as retirement income. I reinvested them the first 5 years. It's impressive how much of a difference that made. I should have started doing that 30 years ago when I was in my 30's. I highly recommend that all young people do exactly that. Start young and just contribute what you can each month. You will be amazed what happens over time.
My new favorite stock. Currently KO is only 6% of my portfolio. I would like to see that closer to 25% by next Summer.
